dialogues.text: That’s why you were hiding he was “seeking” you. Susan pops out of the window seat.

dialogues.text: I don't think Lucy wants to play anymore. :

dialogues.text: I was playing! I was hiding in the wardrobe, and the next thing, I was in a wood and it was snowing... Her brothers and sister exchange puzzled looks.  27 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 19. LUCY (cont’d) I’ve been gone for hours!

dialogues.text: Lucy drags the others to the wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Lucy, the only wood in here is the back of the wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But it’s true. It was all different. Lucy searches the wardrobe, her eyes filling with tears. Peter and Susan share a’ look. LUCY (cont'd) I wouldn't lie about this.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Happens all the time. I founda cricket pitch in the bathroom cupboard only this morning. LUCY BURSTS INTO TEARS and runs crying out of the room. Peter punches Edmund in the arm. EDMUND (cont’d) Ow. What was that for?  28 29 30 31 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 20.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: As if things aren’t difficult enough.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: You always take her side! Edmund storms out. Susan shuts the wardrobe with a firm click. INT. PROFESSOR‘S HOUSE, GIRLS‘ BEDROOM - NIGHT 28 A huge moon bathes the room. Lucy tosses and turns, stari at the ceiling. An ominous RUMBLING disturbs the silence. Lucy looks over see...Susan snoring. Lucy quietly slips out of bed. INT. PROFESSOR’S HOUSE, BEDROOM HALL - NIGHT 29 Lucy eases out of her room, wearing shoes and a raincoat. Carrying a candle, she sneaks away down.the hall. After a moment , a toilet flushes from behind a door: Edmurid steps out of the bathroom to see... Lucy at the far end of the hall. He grins, and creéps after her. Lucy opens the WARDROBE ROOM DOOR. She creeps in, closing behind her. INT. PROFESSOR’S HOUSE, WARDROBE ROOM - NIGHT 30 Lucy’s hand hesitates on the Wardrobe handle. She bites h lip and PULLS THE DOOR OPEN. A WIND BLOWS FROM THE WARDROBE, EXTINGUISHING THE CANDLE. Lucy smiles. INT. PROFESSOR‘'S HOUSE, BEDROOM HALL ~ NIGHT 31 Edmund steps out of the shadows. He reaches up for the kn throws open the door and jumps in to find...  32 33 34 35 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The room lies bare and silent. Edmund smirks at the OPEN WARDROBE DOOR. Edmund makes noises to try and scare Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Luuucecyyyy!! Whooooooe!! It’s the goblins from the warrrdrrrobbbbe! He creeps to the wardrobe. He climbs inside and... SHUTS THE DOOR BEHIND HIM. INT. WARDROBE -— NIGHT 33 DARKNESS. Edmund clunks and struggles in the wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Lucy? He stumbles forward out of the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOW SWIRLS, then settles, revealing, A SMALL FIGURE standing -stock still in a forest clearing

dialogues.text: Lucy? Edmund sees the lamppost, stares wide-eyed at the woods around him. Walks on to,

There...SLEIGH BELLS. He peers into the distance. Through the swirling snow, a flash of black and red appea  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 22. Edmund stares as it grows larger. And larger. Until finally his eyes widen at the sight of A SLEIGH pul by hard-charging WHITE REINDEER. Snow plumes from the runners. Steam jets from the reindee nostrils as...THE SLEIGH BEARS DOWN. dialogues.text: I’m not sure, your Majesty. If it's a dwarf, it’s an ugly one. Edmund turns to the Sleigh where. A FIGURE SITS .IN SHADO The ‘figure steps out of the sleigh. TA BND it moves effortlessly over =the snow.. Edmund watches until... aN Agrontsiitnaliy BEAUTIFUL WOMAN stands before hin.

dialogues.text: oldr Be dr @hat“surrounds Her skin gq. r rohged eae Atop. h

dialogues.text: Gosh. You're really tall. Ginarrbrik jabs Edmund.

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK
dialogues.text: Is that any way to address the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn’t know...your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Ginarrbrik. That’s not how we treat guests. Ginarrbrik loosens his grip, confused. The Witch stares down at Edmund, her green eyes boring in Edmund swallows, transfixed. WHITE WITCH (cont’d) What is your name, Son of Adam? Ginarrbrik raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: E...Edmund.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Edmund, dear. You look so cold. And those are hardly the clothes for this kind of weather. She smiles and extends her slender hand. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) Why don’t you join me? «EDMUND No, that’s... Her eyes flash darkly. Edmund swallow. EDMUND (cont ‘d) All right...thankyou. The Witch sits Edmund beside her in the sleigh, cocooning in her fur. Ginarrbrik scowls and sheathes his dagger.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Yes, please...your Majesty. She takes out a SMALL COPPER VIAL, pops the cork and lets SINGLE DROP fall to the snow. Edmund gapes as the SNOW MELTS UPWARDS, forming a steamin JEWELED CUP. Ginarrbrik hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK
dialogues.text: your drink. Sir.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 24, Edmund hesitates, then sips. His shiverihg stops and a sm spreads across his face.

dialogues.text: It’s dull, Son of Adam, to drink without eating. What would you like best to eat?

dialogues.text: Anything you can imagine. And some things you probably can’t. She smiles. Edmund thinks for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: A connoisseur. She tips the bottle once more, dropping a RUBY-COLORED PR A GLITTERING BOX appears. Ginarrbrik hands at up to. dialogues.text: I don't know. I was just following my sister, and-

dialogues.text: Four. Me, Peter, Susan and Lucy. Ginarrbrik shoots his Queen an alarmed glance.

dialogues.text: Four? Edmund smiles, his mouth gummed up with jelly.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 25.

dialogues.text: Lucy came first. She said she had tea with a faun, but we didn’t believe her. Edmund finishes the Turkish Delight.

dialogues.text: I would very much like to meet your brother and sisters.

dialogues.text: Why? They’re nothing special. Edmund noisily sucks his fingers clean.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: I’m sure they're not as delightful as you are. The Witch plucks off Ginarrbrik’s hat and gently wipes th boy’s sticky mouth. Ginarrbrik seethes. He snatches the h back and wipes it on his trouser leg. SHE LOOKS DEEP INTO EDMUND‘'S EYES, READING HIM. a pow diy, o° WHITE WITCH (cont'd) You know, Edmund,’ I have no children’ of my own. If you were to prove yourself to me, it’s possible that you might one day become Prince of Narnia. (she leans closer) Or perhaps even King. Edmund smiles, then looks doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: You’d probably choose Peter before me. She brushes his hair back from his brow.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: But Edmund, I have chosen you. She smiles warmly at him. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Of course, you‘d need your family. After all, what’s a king without servants? Edmund smiles.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 26.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Peter would be my servant? She turns his head to face TWO DARK HILLS on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: All you’d have to do is bring your brother and sisters to my house. It's just between those hills. She cups his face. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) What fun we're going to have. Edmund smiles. She helps him down from the sled. He looks longingly at the empty box.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Can't I have a bit more-

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: At my house, there are rooms just full of Turkish Delight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ginarrbrik ¢racks his whip and the reindeer spring to lif The Witch waves to-Edmund as the sleigh sweeps her away. Neat WHITE WITCH (cont'd) Until then, dear one! . Don’t forget! ~.Come~soon! The sleigh fades into the white, hazy distance. Edmund stands alone, dazed. After a moment, he hears FOOTSTEPS on the snow behind him

dialogues.text: Edmund? He whips around to see LUCY RUNNING TO HIM. LUCY (cont'd) Oh, Edmund, you got in, too. I told you it was real! Isn’t it wonderful? Edmund wipes his mouth guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Where‘ve you been?  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. Lucy With Mr. Tumnus! The White Witch hasn’t found out anything about him meeting me or letting me go. So everything’s going to be all right after all! Edmund looks down at the sleigh tracks in the snow.

dialogues.text: The White Witch?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: She calls herself the Queen of Narnia, but she’s not the rightful Queen at all. Edmund shivers and turns away. LucY (cont'd) Don’t you feel well, Edmund? You look awful. Edmund frowns at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Well, it's pretty poor sport standing‘around freezing in the snow. How do we get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: This way, silly. Lucy takes his hand. He stumbles along with her, pale. LUCY (cont’d) The others will have to believe in Narnia now that we've both been here. 36 INT. PROFESSOR’S HOUSE, GIRLS’ BEDROOM — NIGHT LUCY SHAKES SUSAN.

Peter moves Lucy down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Narnia. It’s all in the wardrobe like I told you. And this time, Edmund went, too! They all turn to Edmund. LUCY (cont ’d) Tell them, Ed. Lucy ‘smiles at him, her eyes shining. . Edmund opens his to speak, but... MRS. MACREADY (0%5,3” What in the world is going on? Mrs. Macready stands in the doorway in a flannel nightgow EDMUND'S DARK EYES stare blankly for a long moment. Final

dialogues.text: I don’t know what kind of home you children come from, but in this house, we work during the day and we sleep at night. She glares at them before closing the door.

dialogues.text: Shut up. You’re not Dad! I wish you weren't even my brother!! Peter fumes, frustrated. INT. PROFESSOR’S HOUSE, BEDROOM HALL - DAY 38 Peter drags his heels as he and Susan climb the stairs.

dialogues.text: Not her, the forest. Peter and Susan look at each other, confused. : “PETER «~ . You're not saying:you: believe her? ; “PROFESSOR KIRKE Well, how do you know her story isn‘t true?

dialogues.text: Edmund said that they had just been pretending.

PROFESSOR KIRKE (cont'd) If Lucy isn’t lying, and she’s not mad, then logically, unless further evidence turns up... He lights his pipe, waves away a cloud of smoke. PROFESSOR KIRKE (cont’‘d) We must assume she's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But it’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIRKE
dialogues.text: There's that word. Seems to make everything smaller somehow, doesn't it? Peter and Susan gape. The Professor pulls up a chair. “PROFESSOR KIRKE (cont‘d) Now what did Lucy say...exactly? 40 INT. PROFESSOR’S HOUSE ~.DAY 40 Peter and Susan close the Professor's door behind them. Peter is quite taken aback.

dialogues.text: Well, that was unexpected.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN

Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 34. In the other room, EDMUND looks down at huge SWORD IN A G CASE, ANNOYED BY THEIR LAUGHTER. LUCY serves, giggling.

FOOTSTEPS CLATTER BEHIND THEM  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 35. They run down the hall. FOOTSTEPS RUMBLE IN FRONT OF THEM They race along the maze of passages, FOOTSTEPS CLOMPING AROUND THEM.

Peter looks at Susan, then they both look at THE WARDROBE

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: _ LUCY
dialogues.text: You're right. It wouldn't. She pulls out A SNOWBALL and WHIPS it at Peter. oo, LUCY (cont'd) But’ that might! {HE THREE OF THEM scramble into a brief, wild snowball fi It only ends when an errant snowball flies through the ai AND HITS A VERY GUILTY-LOOKING EDMUND IN THE FACE.

dialogues.text: Oww. Stop it! The fight stops. They all stare at Edmund. Peter gives a low whistle.

dialogues.text: Ed, don’t-

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: All right! I’m sorry. Peter looks at Edmund, disgusted. He walks away. The Pevensies stand theré in silence. SUSAN . Maybe we should.go back. Edmund just stares through the trees...AT TWO DARK HILLS THE DISTANCE.

dialogues.text: I think Lucy should decide what we do. Peter turns to Lucy. She smiles. Lucy Let‘s go see Mr. Tumnus!

dialogues.speaker: PETER

SUSAN (cont'd) I really don't understand. Lucy reaches in and grabs a coat of her own.  47 48 “Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 38. dialogues.text: I‘d hurry. They get rather unpleasant when they're hungry. THE FIRST PAW SCRATCHES AT THE LIP OF THE HOLE.

dialogues.text: Follow him. Fox whirls and darts into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But-

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Go. Beaver sets his feet and faces the HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: I‘1l take my chances, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: You‘ll do no such thing. Mrs. Beaver tugs her husband away. EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE -— NIGHT 74 The Pevensies and the Beavers scramble after Fox. Suddenly, Fox stops. He sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: A delicate perfume. He smiles at Susan. FOX (cont'd) An item of your clothing, please, Your Highness.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 58.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What? Peter gets it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Give him your jumper. Susan looks down at her CARDIGAN with its SCHOOL CREST.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Wolves. Hungry wolves. Susan yanks off her sweater and gives it to Fox. He bows, then WHISTLES. The trees above them rustle. Everyone locks up, alarmed a TWO SATYRS DROP DOWN, landing lithely on muscular legs. Fox tosses them the sweater. FOX, (cont'd) Take them.on a run, boys. The satyrs break off into the trees, Susan's sweater fluttering behind them. | Fox-turns back to the group. FOX, (cont'd) Now, if you will. HE POINTS UP A TREE. 75 EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE - NIGHT 75 WOLVES tear through the town, KNOCKING OVER THE STONE BAD They burst into the forest, only to find... 76 EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE — NIGHT 76 Fox casually sweeping the snow with his tail.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Greetings, wolf brethren. The wolves skid to a stop. Fox smiles innocently.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 59. FOX (cont‘d) Lost something, have we?

dialogues.speaker: MAUGRIM
dialogues.text: Where are the humans?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Now, that’s a valuable piece of information, don’t you think? He leans against a tree. TILT UP THE TRUNK, high into the air, where...Peter, Susa Lucy and the Beavers watch from a platform. Peter grits his teeth. Below, Fox grooms his tail. FOX (cont‘d) I imagine there’d be at least a nominal reward for something like

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maugrim’s lieutenant, VARDAN, CLAMPS DOWN ON FOX‘’S NECK. Lucy. gasps. _ Susan‘ élaps her hand over her sister‘s mo Maugrim leans into Fox's trembling face.

dialogues.speaker: MAUGRIM
dialogues.text: Your reward: is your life. Now, where are they? Vardan tightéfis* his jaws. Fox yelps. Slowly, HE RAISES PAW “TO POINT... Susan bites her lip. Peter’s hand clenches into a fist. But Fox points off INTO THE FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: South. They ran south. Peter relaxes his hand. Another wolf examines the ground where Fox pointed.

dialogues.speaker: WOLF
dialogues.text: Captain, the scent continues. VARDAN THROWS FOX TO THE GROUND. MAUGRIM HOWLS, leading h pack after the satyrs. in the tree, Lucy stares down at Fox's motionless body.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 60. Suddenly, his bushy tail twitches...and waves. Lucy grins Fox stands and smiles up at them.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t worry, your Majesty. Their bark is worse than their bite.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Why do you keep calling us that? Fox looks at her curiously. He turns to Beaver.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: They don’t know? Peter eyes Beaver, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don‘t know what? EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE - NIGHT 77 Fox hands Beaver a’ branch. Beaver bites it down to size tosses it on a fire. Mrs. Beavér passes out bread and jam

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: There‘s a prophecy. Peter, Susan and Lucy stare at Beaver. MR. BEAVER (cont‘d) “When Adam's flesh and Adam's bone Sits at Cair Paravel in throne, The evil time will be over and done.” The kids just stare. MR. BEAVER (cont'd) I know it doesn't quite rhyme.... Mrs. Beaver pats him on the paw. Beaver continues. MR. BEAVER (cont'd) On the shore of the Eastern Ocean is a castle, Cair Paravel. Inside are four thrones. It is said, when two Sons of Adam and Two Daughters of Eve fill those thrones, Narnia will once more be at peace.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 61.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: And the Witch’s reign will be over, The Beavers and Fox beam at them. The Pevensies stare in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And you think we're the ones?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You'd better be.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: We've been expecting you for a hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry, but you've made a mistake. We're not heroes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We're from Finchley. Susan stares at the three expectant animals.

dialogues.speaker: . SUSAN
dialogues.text: This makes absolutely no sense.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Your sense comes from your world, child, This is.foretold in the Déep Magic, and what is written there, shall be. The children stare, gobsmacked.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You'’ve come to save Narnia...

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Whether you like it or not 78 EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE -—- NIGHT 78 The Beavers sleep, their tails draped over each other. Lu and the Fox doze by the waning fire. Peter sits watching over them. Susan joins him, bleary-ey

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Magic wardrobes, talking animals, and not a pillow in the entire country.  79 80 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 62. Peter smiles, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: All Mum asked me to do was to look after all of you...and I couldn't even do that. He sighs and looks over at the sleeping animals. PETER (CONT'D) (cont‘d) Let alone what they expect.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What they expect doesn't matter. Because it isn’t true.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And what happens when they work that out?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That we're not mythical kings and queens? We get Edmund and we go home. Peter looks toward the sleeping animals. PETER . They won’t be happy...sand they have pretty sharp ‘teeth. They both stare into the fire. Susan sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: We should have gotten Edmund a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WOLFPACK stumbles up the hill, drained. INT. WITCH’S CASTLE, DUNGEON - NIGHT 80 Edmund trembles in the corner of his cell. When he looks he catches TUMNUS WATCHING HIM. Edmund quickly looks away Suddenly, THE LOCK CLANGS. Edmund stands as... THE WITCH STRIDES IN WITH GINARRBRIK,.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: The police tore that dam apart... Edmund goes white.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 63. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Your little family was nowhere to be found. Edmund breathes again, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Did you look under everything? SHE GRABS HIS FACE. Tumnus watches in terror.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Where did they go? They must have said something? Edmund whimpers. Tumnus grips his bars.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The Beaver said something about...Aslan? THE WITCH'S EYES FREEZE. She drops Edmund to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Aslan? She rubs her mouth; as if suddenly starving. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) Where?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUMNUS
dialogues.text: He‘s a stranger here, your Majesty. He doesn’t know anything! The Witch glares at Tumnus. Ginarrbrik knocks the faun ba She turns back to Edmund.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: I said, where is Aslan? Tumnus shoots Edmund a desperate look. Edmund stares at h for a long moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I left before they said...I wanted to see you. The Witch purses her lips.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 64.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Release the faun.

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK
dialogues.text: But, your Majesty-

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Do it. Ginarrbrik drags Tumnus out. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) Do you know why you're here, faun? He tries to straighten up proudly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUMNUS
dialogues.text: Because I believe in a free Narnia.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: You’re here because he turned you in. For sweets. (ALT: For candy) Tumnus looks at Edmund, confused. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Take him upstairs.’ Ginarrbrik drags Tumnus away. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) And ready my* Sleigh. Edmund just presses his ‘face against the bars, crying. 81 EXT. WITCH'S CASTLE, COURTYARD — DAWN 81 Two dwarfs drag Edmund past dozens of the Witch‘s statues Suddenly, his face goes cold: There, trapped in an alcove, illuminated by flickering torchlight, stands... MR. TUMNUS. FROZEN IN PAIN. Edmund stares, his spirit broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WITCH'S SLEIGH ROCKETS OUT OF THE GATES, followed by howling wolf pack. Ginarrbrik cracks his whip wildly.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 65. The Witch stands tall in the rear, her robes snapping beh her. At her feet, Edmund cowers. EXT. ALLIES’ ENCLAVE - DAWN 83 Peter sleeps by the now dead fire. Suddenly, he awakens t CRACKING SOUND. Through THE BLACK AND WHITE TRUNKS of the frozen forest, Peter can make out...RED. He picks up a stick and moves through the trees. He pushe past a branch and gasps. A LUSH CHERRY TREE BURSTS WITH LIVING COLOR in the midst the frozen wood. Peter stares at the full bunches of bright fruit. Slowly, RED PETALS flutter from the tree. They pour down, then sweep up, coalescing into the shape of... A WOMAN. Peter’s eyes -go wide. He raises his stick.

dialogues.speaker: DRYAD
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to fear, my King. Her voice chimes like a bell. Peter has to shake himself.

dialogues.speaker: . PETER
dialogues.text: “I'm: nobody's king. The Dryad moves forward with the sound of rustling leaves

dialogues.speaker: DRYAD
dialogues.text: You have freed the spirits of the trees from the prison of our frozen boughs.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look, I did no such-

dialogues.speaker: DRYAD
dialogues.text: Sshh. You might feel like a sapling... Her hand brushes his cheek. He blushes, dropping his stic DRYAD (cont'd) But a sapling is a tree nonetheless. The Dryad takes Peter's hand  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 66. DRYAD (cont’d) The wind brings a message of great urgency. Your brother is alive. She stares deep into his eyes. DRYAD (cont‘d) But you must hurry if you hope to save him. The White Witch is on her way. Peter stares, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Who are- But she just kisses his hand and BURSTS into a thousand petals. They flutter up and vanish into the cherry tree. Dazed, Peter opens his hand. A PERFECT PINK CHERRY BLOSSO appears where she kissed it. 84 EXT. ROCK BRIDGE — DAY 84 The Pevensies.and Beavers stare out, in awe. BEFORE THEM SPREADS NARNIA...VAST, OPEN AND WHITE. The Fox stands proudly.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: I told. you it wasn’t all trees.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It‘s enormous.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: It's the world, my dear, did you expect it to be small? Peter peers out across the immense expanse.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Where’s the Stone Table?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You see that frozen lake? Beyond that is Shuddering Wood, and then some foothills. You see the largest of them far off there? A TINY DARK MOUND wavers on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Barely.  85 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Well, the little gray bit on top of that, that’s the Stone Table.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I thought you said you knew a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: You’ll save two days if you cross the Frozen River, Susan peers at a long green strip in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Frozen? Is it safe?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Hard as a rock for a hundred years. Quite lovely, actually. Almost wish I was crossing it with you.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T might’ve known.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Friend. Aslan’s readying an army. He‘ll need soldiers and I can get them. Fox turns to the children. FOX (cont'd) It’s been a distinct honour and privilege, your Majesties. He turns to go. Mrs. Beaver nudges Mr. Beaver.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Oh. .ah...Fox...? The Fox turns. MR. BEAVER (cont'd) Good luck. They exchange a smile.

85 FIVE TINY FIGURES make their way over a landscape of whit  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved, 68. The Beavers gallop easily over the snowy plain. The Pevensies lag behind, their legs bogging down in the snow

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If he tells us to hurry one more time, I'm going to use his tail as a cricket bat. At the shore, Beaver clambers atop a mound,

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Hurry, humans! While you're still young! Peter seethes. Something catches Beaver’s eye. In the far distance...A ROOSTERTAIL OF SNOW PLUMES IN THE AIR. Beaver’s eyes go wide. He cups his paws: MR. BEAVER (cont’d) Hurry up! Run! Run! out in the snow, the children sigh.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Hé is getting a bit bossy. Mrs. Beaver jumps up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND YOU! IT’S HER! The children turn: ” A SPEEDING SLEIGH BEARS DOWN ON THEM. Peter grabs Lucy and runs for shore. The air shakes with the sound of SLEIGH BELLS. Susan slips on the ice, scrambling. Atop the sleigh, A TALL FIGURE stands at the reigns. Beaver points to a SMALL, HOLE between two icy slabs.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Inside! Dive! Dive! The children throw themselves into the hole. Beaver jams himself in. He sticks for a moment, then slip inside, tail flapping behind.  86 87 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 69. INT. SHUDDERING WOOD — DAY 86 Beavers and humans lie crammed in a tiny hole, trembling the SLEIGH BELLS GROW LOUDER. Finally, with a hiss of runners, THE SLEIGH STOPS RIGHT OUTSIDE. A shadow passes over the mouth of the hole. Lucy swallows They wait. Finally,

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Perhaps she’s gone. Both girls look at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I guess £'11 look.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: No. You're worth nothing to Narnia dead. Beaver squares his shoulders. Mrs. Beaver reaches for him “ MRS. BEAVER Neither are you, Beaver. He sqpieezes her hand, then slips into the light. Everyone waits. Susan holds Mrs. Beaver, frightened. And then comes the sound of...LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come up! Come out! Beaver pops his face back into the hole. MR. BEAVER (cont‘d) There's someone here to see you. EXT. FROZEN LAKE -— DAY 87 Lucy peeks out of the hole. TWO HUGE REINDEER REST IN FRONT OF AN ANCIENT SLEIGH. And there, next to Beaver, stands... A TALL MAN IN A BRIGHT RED ROBE AND A GREAT WHITE BEARD. BROADSWORD ON HIS HIP, he could be an ancient WARRIOR or.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 70. Lucy GRINS

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, sir. FATHER CHRISTMAS beams. He gladly shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Lucy. Peter gapes. Astonished.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: After all these years.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I’ve put up with a lot since I got here, but this- Peter steps in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We heard there was no Christmas in Narnia.

dialogues.speaker: . FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Thé Witch has kept me out for a long time. But her magic is finally’ weakening. The ice is dosing its grip on the world. - thanks to you all.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN -
dialogues.text: what? y

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You’ve given Narnia back its hope. He reaches into his sleigh and pulls out a SACK. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont'd) You've still a difficult road ahead, however. I hope these will be of some help along your way. Father Christmas turns to Peter. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont‘d) peter, the time to use these is near at hand. Bear them well. He gives him A SHIELD, SWORD AND SCABBARD. Peter examines the sword, AWESTRUCK AND REVERENT.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 71.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Susan shoots him a look, surprised. Father Christmas crouches before Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: For you, Lucy... He gives her a small JEWELED VIAL. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont‘d) fhe juice of the fire-flower. One drop will cure any injury. And, though I pray you never have to use it... He hands her a TINY DAGGER. Lucy weighs it in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I think I could be brave enough.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I’m sure you could, my dear, but battles are ugly affairs. He turns to Susan: FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont'd) Now Susan, because.life is not lived entirely in the mind... He hands her .a BOW and QUIVER OF ARROWS. She holds them awkwardly with her fingertips. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont‘d) And though you don’t seem to have a problem making yourself heard... Father Christmas gives her a wink. Susan blinks, startled He gives her an IVORY HORN. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont.’d) Blow this, and wherever you are, help will come.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But I don’t Father Christmas just climbs into his sleigh.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I must be off. The work does pile up when you've been gone a hundred years.  88 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 72. He turns to the Beavers. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont’d) But don’t worry. Your gifts will be awaiting your return. Lucy looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But...what about for Edmund?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I hope these gifts will help you save him. He cups her chin. FATHER CHRISTMAS (cont ‘d) That you're willing to try should be gift enough for Edmund. Peter steps forward, his sword hanging regally at his sid

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghank you, your highness. Long live Aslan. And Merry Christmas. He cracks the reins. The sleigh shoots off across the ice the menacing roostertail; now a béautiful sight. Everyone watches him gos.-Finally, Lucy turns to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I told you he was real. Susan opens her mouth to speak, then just shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her sleigh, the Witch leads her hunting party. Ginarrbrik smiles as muddy slush spatters Edmund's face.

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK
dialogues.text: Is it me, your majesty, or is there a touch of spring in the air?

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: It’s you, Ginarrbrik. Maugrim drops back and runs alongside the sleigh.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 73. MAUGRIM ‘ We've picked up the scent, your majesty. He’s just up ahead. The Witch smiles.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Delightful. EXT. NARNIA, OAK FOREST — DAY 89 Fox prepares his party for war. Satyrs and squirrels pack provisions.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Pack light, my friends... He nudges a WINE BOTTLE over to a squirrel. FOX (cont'd) But not too light. The squirrel looks past Fox and...DROPS THE BOTTLE. Seein the squirrel’s terrified eyes, Fox spins. THERE STANDS°THE WITCH. EDMUND SITS IN THE NEARBY SLEIGH.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Having a picnic?

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Your highness. Why...yes. And we couldn’t have asked for a lovelier “guest of honor.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: How gracious. And you were so helpful to my wolves last evening. I thought perhaps you might assist me now. She smiles tightly and pulls out her wand. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Where have they gone? Where is Aslan? Fox shoots the others a look of resolve. He swallows.

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: Aslan...is back? Well I suppose we should set another place... The Witch strokes Fox's chin with her wand.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 74.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Such a charming creature. And such a dead one. THE WITCH RAISES HER WAND TO STRIKE.

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: Edmund jumps forward, eyes wide. EDMUND (cont'd) The Stone Table. The Beaver said something about the Stone Table. That Aslan was there. The Fox drops his head. The Witch turns, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Thank you Edmund. I’m glad these poor creatures were able witness some honesty. Edmund sags. “WHITE WITCH \(cont/d) Before they die. SHE BRINGS THE WAND. DOWN, PIERCING THE WOODEN TABLE. ‘TH ANIMALS SCREAM AS THE MAGIC RADIATES OUTWARD.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Edmund watches ‘in horror as the squirrels and satyrs TUR STONE. Fox gives one last growl, then goes marble. The Witch slaps Edmund, then grabs his face harshly.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Think about which side you‘re on Son of Adam. Mine... (twists his head around) ...or theirs. The Witch turns to MAUGRIM AND HIS LIEUTENANT. WHITE WITCH (cont’d) They‘11 try and make for the River. Gather your swiftest wolves. She turns to Edmund and tousles his hair. WHITE WITCH (contd) Little Edmund misses his family. Don't you, dear?  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 75. Edmund just stares, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pevensies follow the Beavers through a sparse forest. Around them, water drips from THAWING ICICLES. Lucy I wonder if the Professor had any galoshes in his wardrobe. SUSAN'S FOOT SINKS IN A PUDDLE. She yanks it out, all sog

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to go back and get them. The Beavers stop, absolutely still.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Quiet. The children listen. Then they all hear.it...RUNNING WATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group stands on.a precipice, staring down at... THE GREAT RIVER. Cracks run along its frozen surface. Dar green water shoots “underneath. {TO THEIR LEFT, A MASSIVE FROZEN WATERFALL looms, huge ch of ice cracking off. TO THEIR RIGHT, THE RIVER FLOWS. Plates of ice break away shooting downstream.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Our shortcut is melting. Lucy stares down the rocky slope to the jagged ice.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What do we do? Peter’s eyes flick from shore to shore, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We cross.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: We'll never make it.  92 93 94 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 76. Peter adjusts his shield and sword, looking steely.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not if we keep talking about it. Peter scrambles down the hill. After a beat, the others follow. The Beavers look at each other, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SULLEN GROWL cuts the air. MAUGRIM steps out of the shadows, sniffing SUSAN‘S FOOTPRINT. More wolves prowl out behind him. EXT. GREAT RIVER — DAY 93 PETER’S BEATEN BROWN SHOE steps onto the ice. It crackles Beaver looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Maybe I ought to go first. Tentatively,. Beaver leads them onto the surface of the r THE ICE GROANS OMINOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan grips Lucy’s hand. She glares at Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Tf<Mum knew what you were doing...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Mum’s not here. A CRACK RIPS OPEN behind them. Icy water sprays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below, FIVE TINY FIGURES slip across the ice. Maugrim and his pack prowl onto the cliff. He looks from children below to the WATERFALL above them.

dialogues.speaker: MAUGRIM
dialogues.text: Vardan, you're with me. The rest of you remain here.

dialogues.speaker: VARDAN
dialogues.text: Captain?  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 77

dialogues.speaker: MAUGRIM
dialogues.text: I’m not losing them again. MAUGRIM HEADS TOWARD THE FALLS. Vardan follows reluctantl EXT. GREAT RIVER — DAY 95 Beaver presses ahead of the others, testing the ice. Susan slips, landing on Mrs. Beaver‘s tail.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
