dialogues.text: Peter stares out the flap, watching troops prepare for battle. His hand fumbles nervously with his sword. Inside, Susan, Lucy and Edmund eat breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Narnia‘s not going to run out of toast, Ed.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 96 Edmund smiles, his mouth full.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And I’m sure they’ll pack something up for us when we go. Lucy looks up from her eggs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Back to the lamp-post. We could be home in a couple of days. Everyone stops. Susan shifts in her seat. SUSAN (cont'd) Well, now that we’ve got Edmund back-

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But we can’t leave now! Peter turns from the flap and faces his family. : © PETER | Aslan didn't rescue Edmund so we could just abandon Narnia.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It’s a war, Peter. She looks to Edmund for support. SUSAN (cont'd) Edmund already nearly lost his life! What are we supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Whatever we can. They all look surprised. Edmund puts his fork down, grave serious. EDMUND (cont'd) I’ve seen what the Witch can do. I helped her do it. He pushes away his plate. EDMUND (cont'd) I’m not leaving these people behind to suffer for it.  “Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 97. PETER LOOKS AT HIS BROTHER, RESPECT GROWING ON HIS FACE. Lucy takes Edmund's hand. Peter turns to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ed’s right. We have to do our part.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Does our part include getting killed?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: We just have to make sure it doesn't. The tent grows quiet. After a long moment, Susan stands,

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I guess that’s it then.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Where are you going? She takes her BOW AND QUIVER from a hook.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: fo get in some practice. 120 EXT. ASLAN’S CAMP, PRACTICE GROUND - DAY 120 SUSAN pulls her bow tight and lets fly...MISSING THE TARG ENTIRELY... LUCY hands her another arrow. Susan shoots...STICKING HER ARROW IN THE EDGE OF THE TARG Lucy hands over another arrow. Across the field, Edmund wobbles unsteadily atop a BROWN HORSE.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Whoa, there. Horsie. The horse rolls its eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN HORSE
dialogues.text: My name is Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Oh. A few feet away, Peter stares, uncertain.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 98.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Are you sure about this? A SLEEK WHITE UNICORN goes down on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: UNICORN
dialogues.text: It would be an honor, my lord. Peter and Edmund go thundering by on their steeds. Susan aims and...NAILS THE TARGET JUST OFF CENTER. She no with satisfaction... UNTIL A TINY DAGGER FLIES IN AND STICKS THE BULLSEYE. Luc smiles innocently. Peter and Edmund thunder past, INSTRUCTED by TWO CENTAURS Edmund holds his sword high, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Bow down or taste steel. Peter laughs and charges, meeting Edmund's sword with his

dialogues.speaker: CENTAUR
dialogues.text: No. Lean forward! Sword point up.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Peter! Edmund! Peter's HORSE REARS to avoid crushing Beaver.

dialogues.speaker: PHILIP
dialogues.text: Watch out, Beaver!

dialogues.speaker: BEAVER
dialogues.text: The Witch has demanded a meeting with Aslan. She's on her way here.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What does she want?

dialogues.speaker: BEAVER
dialogues.text: Nobody knows. But Aslan has agreed to see her on condition she comes without her wand. SUDDENLY, HORNS ECHO ACROSS THE CAMP. Everyone turns to s

dialogues.speaker: BLACK BIRDS CIRCLING OVERHEAD,
dialogues.text: EXT. ASLAN’S CAMP - DAY 121 A DARK PROCESSION MARCHES FORWARD.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 99.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER, A PHALANX OF MINOTAURS MARCHES IN LOCKSTEP.
dialogues.text: Peter and Lucy scowl. Susan puts her hand on Edmund. He doesn’t shake it off. ASLAN’S ARMY rumbles with an uneasy snarl. Ginarrbrik runs ahead of the procession. He cups his hand

dialogues.speaker: GINARRBRIK
dialogues.text: Jadis, Queen of Narnia! Empress of the Lone Islands- ASLAN'S ARMY ROARS IN PROTEST, DROWNING HIM OUT. The cyclops lower the Witch down, right in front of... ASLAN, who waits with the Pevensies under his flag. The L raises his paw for silence. The growling dies. The Witch gazes at him...and smiles. ; _ WHITE WITCH . You have. a traitor amongst you Aslan. Edmund swallows.

dialogues.speaker: . ASLAN
dialogues.text: His offense was not against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten the Deep Magic?

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Don’t cite law to me, witch. I was there when it was written.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Then you should know it well. Every traitor belongs to me. Lucy gasps. Edmund just shuts his eyes. Beaver growls.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BEAVER
dialogues.text: Try and take him then!

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Peace, Beaver.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 100.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: (to beaver) Do you really think your master can rob me of my rights by mere force? (looks at Aslan) He knows that unless I have blood as the Law says, all Narnia will be overturned and perish in fire and water. Aslan stares at the Witch, smouldering. She smiles. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) You dare not refuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: What you say... Peter apprehensively watches Aslan. ASLAN (cont‘d) Is true. Edmund opens his eyes, devastated. Lucy’s face goes red.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It-can’t be true! “How can it be right to give Edmund to her? Aslan looks at her sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that it was right.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You said you’d help him! You said he was safe! The Witch looks sideways at Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: I don't know, Edmund...perhaps I’'11 call off our little bargain. She swivels slowly to Edmund, mouth stretched in a grin. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) They wouldn't have made such good servants after all. Edmund‘s face drops. Susan takes her arm away. Peter and Lucy sag. Aslan growls.  Markus & MoFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 101. ASLAN ’ Enough. I shall talk with you alone. ASLAN AND THE WITCH WALK INTO HIS TENT. Everyone turns to Edmund. He wraps his arms around himsel

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmund sits forlornly on the ground, pulling out blades o grass. Lucy leans on his back, glum. Susan looks at them, then to Peter, who stares at the ten A bee buzzes. A bird chirps. And then...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They're coming. All eyes turn to Aslan and the Witch as they exit the ten The Witch beams, triumphant. Aslan stares at. Edmund fora long time, then raises his h to take in the entire assembly. He finishes on the childr

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: She* has renounced her: claim on your brother's blood. Edmund’s mouth drops open. Peter claps him on the shoulde The Witch mounts her bier, then peers down at Aslan.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: But how do I know this promise will be kept? Aslan's black eyes bore into her. THEN HE ROARS. The Witch steps back, afraid. She signals to her troops, marches away, trying to maintain her dignity The crowd jeers as she leaves, then rejoices once she’s g Susan hugs a relieved Edmund. Only Lucy watches Aslan pad sadly into his tent.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 102. 123 EXT. ASLAN’S CAMP, CAMPFIRE - NIGHT 123 Peter walks with Aslan.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Will there still be war?

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Nothing has changed. Aslan acknowledges some creatures preparing their weapons ASLAN (cont'd) Tomorrow will be hard, Peter. Have no doubt about that.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I had a thought. If I were the Witch-

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: I would enjoy this talk much less, Peter stops and stares at the deadpan Lion. Aslan‘s whisk twitch, then“he smiles. Peter laughs. ” » ASLAN “(cont'd) Continue, Son of Adam. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: If I were the Witch, I might try an attack during the night. It happens a lot back home. We‘’d be safer if our camp was on the other side of the river.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: An idea worthy of a general. But don’t worry. Aslan lays a paw on Peter’s shoulder. ASLAN (cont‘d) The Witch will not make an attack tonight. The great Lion walks away. Peter looks after him, puzzled 124 EXT. ASLAN‘'S CAMP - NIGHT 124 The FULL MOON shines over flickering watchfires.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 103. 125 INT. ASLAN’S CAMP, GIRLS’ TENT -— NIGHT 125 Susan sleeps, her blanket wrapped tight around her. On he cot, LUCY STARES AT THE WALL. She blinks sleepily and then HER EYES GO WIDE. ASLAN’S SHADOW MOVES PAST THE TENT. 126 EXT. ASLAN’S CAMP, GIRLS’ TENT - NIGHT 126 Lucy and Susan step out in robes and slippers. ASLAN walks slowly into the woods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan lumbers heavily, his head down, his tail dragging. Susan and Lucy sneak from tree to tree, following. 128 EXT. FOREST, NEAR STONE TABLE ~ NIGHT ». 128 Aslan’s paws flatten the grass. The girls hesitate, then follow him onto the exposed plai THE LION STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Children... He turns and STARES AT THEM, his eyes big and sorrowful. ASLAN (cont'd) Why are you following me? Lucy stands, small and exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We couldn’t sleep. They hike their hems and run to him across the wet grass.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Please. Couldn't we come with you? Aslan sighs.  129 130 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 104, ASLAN . I'd be glad of the company. But promise me you’ll stop when I tell you. He stares off across the plain. ASLAN (cont’d) After that, I must go on alone. Aslan smiles sadly, then walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aslan leads the girls up the steep slope. They rest their hands on his fur. Near the top, he turns.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: It is time to return. And, no matter what, do not let yourselves be seen by anyone.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But, Aslan— Aslan stops her with a look. ASLAN . Thank you, girls. Now go. With one last look at them, Aslan disappears over the rid Beyond the rise, FIRELIGHT flickers. Susan looks toward camp, but Lucy gives her a tug. They crawl toward a scrub bush at the very top. They peer through the leaves and gasp. EXT. THE STONE TABLE —- NIGHT 130 Aslan walks alone toward THE STONE TABLE, his head lowere avoiding the sight of...DOZENS OF VILE CREATURES.

dialogues.speaker: HORRORS.
dialogues.text: The air hangs still. Torches burn straight to the sky. Finally, Aslan looks up. There, at the foot of the Stone Table, stands...

dialogues.speaker: THE WHITE WITCH,
dialogues.text: Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 105. The girls gasp. Aslan stares at the Witch. The Witch stares back, hesitan FINALLY, SHE GRINS.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Behold. The great lion. FOUR HAGS go out to Aslan. They peer at him, SCARED. Finally, one pokes the Lion with a bony finger. The hags break into a cackle. THE WHOLE CROWD EXPLODES WITH SICK LAUGHTER. Aslan just stares at the Witch. Creatures rush the proud Lion, KNOCKING him over, ROLLING onto his back. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Bind him! Lucy tries to go to him. Siwsan holds.her down. “Ss LUCY ote Why doesn’t he fight back? HARPIES bind Aslan's feet and drag him along the ground. The Witch raises a pale hand.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: Stop. The crowd freezes. WHITE WITCH (cont‘d) Let him first be shaved. THE CROWD ROARS. AN OGRE HACKS OFF ASLAN’S MANE. Lucy weeps. Susan just rocks back and forth. Aslan’s hair lies shorn around him. His face looks smalle his head bleeding from tiny cuts.

dialogues.speaker: CREATURES
dialogues.text: Here kitty, kitty...Meow...Does pussums want a bowl of milk? Lucy turns her head, unable to watch.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 106. THEY KICK AND BEAT ASLAN. TINY CREATURES’ SPIT ON HIM. Aslan just stares up sadly at the night sky. They muzzle him, cinching black leather over his mouth. Ogres lift Aslan onto the Table. Hags bind him to the roc A HUSH FALLS OVER THE SCENE. At last, the Witch climbs atop the Table. She bares her white arms, drawing from her robes... A STONE KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: And now, Aslan, who has won? Did you really think that by all this you would save the human traitor? So the Deep Magic will be appeased, but when you are dead...what’s to prevent me from killing him as well? From killing all of them? She leans close to Aslan's ear. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) (sargastically) . My. good word? The Witch takes one final look at Aslan, bound, blood run from the wounds on his head. WHITE WITCH. (cont'd) Understand, you have given up your life and saved no one’s. In that knowledge, despair...and die! ASLAN’S GAZE MOVES FROM THE SKY... TO LUCY, HIDING IN THE SHADOWS. THEIR EYES LOCK. The Witch slowly cocks back the cruel knife...then savage SLASHES DOWNWARD. Aslan‘s eyes close. Susan and Lucy turn away. The Witch raises her bloody dagger high. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) Narnia is ours! The CROWD SHRIEKS. WHITE WITCH (cont’d) General, prepare your troops for battle...  131 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 107. The Witch looks down at Aslan. WHITE WITCH (cont'd) However short it may be. THE HORRORS DANCE IN A FRENZY, SILHOUETTED IN THE FIRE. Susan and Lucy COWER as...

dialogues.speaker: THE WITCH LEADS HER MINIONS RIGHT PAST THEIR HIDING PLACE
dialogues.text: Finally, the last tentacle drags past, leaving the hill i SILENCE AND MOONLIGHT. The girls slowly approach the LIFELESS LION. Susan strokes his limp paw. Lucy kisses his head. Hopeful

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: He’s still warm. BUT SHE REALIZES THERE IS NO LIFE IN HIM. SHE WEEPS. Susan fumbles at the muzzle around Aslan’s mouth. Finally it comes free. Aslan’s noble face hangs slack.

dialogues.speaker: _ SUSAN
dialogues.text: He must have known what he was doing... Susan breaks down. . Lucy holds her. They sob quietly in moonlight, sitting vigil. Slowly, Lucy’s.eyes focus. She squints.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Get away! Get away, all of you! She swats at the mice, then stops, stunned. THE MICE BEGIN TO CHEW THE ROPES, FREEING ASLAN. EXT. ASLAN’S CAMP - NIGHT 131 A CENTAUR SENTRY looks up to see... A SATYR RUNNING FULL SPEED FOR THE CAMP.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 108.

dialogues.speaker: SATYR SCOUT
dialogues.text: They’re on the move! 132 INT. ASLAN’S CAMP, BOYS’ TENT ~ NIGHT 132 Peter writhes, asleep, bound up in his sheets. SUDDENLY, EDMUND SHAKES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Peter, get up! Peter’s eyes open just as...A WARNING BELL RINGS FRANTICA OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: The Witch's army’s coming! Peter reaches shakily for HIS SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Get Susan.and Lucy and meet me in Aslan's tent. 133 INT. ASLAN’S CAMP, ASLAN'S TENT - NIGHT : 133 Peter rushes to Aslan’s tent, but finds the flap hanging open. He walks in cautiously. Edmund rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: The girls are gone. Peter indicates THE EMPTY TENT.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Maybe they’re with Aslan. Qutside, armor clanks as the army girds for war. PETER (cont'd) What are we supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: What do you mean we? Peter looks at him, worried.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 109. EDMUND (cont’d) Aslan wanted you to take over. Peter swallows.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're all crazy.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Susan and Lucy thought you could do it. And you're sure a better choice than me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, you're right, there. They both smile. Edmund stands, straightening his sword.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: There's an army out there ready to follow you. He fixes his big brother with a Look. = EDMUND “{(cont’d) And so am I. Peter stares at Edmund, moved.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: The girls-

dialogues.speaker: . EDMUND
dialogues.text: Wherever they are, we can’t help them if we lose this battle. Peter stares at a standard. The RED LION stares back at h 134 EXT. ASLAN‘S CAMP, ASLAN’S TENT - NIGHT 134 Beaver, Oreius, and a handful of soldiers wait expectantl Suddenly, the flap opens. PETER STEPS OUT, HESITANT. Edmu stands at his side.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Gather your troops and strike camp. We march within the hour! Oreius looks past Peter into the tent.

dialogues.speaker: ORETUS
dialogues.text: Sir?  135 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 110

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (commanding) We're better off meeting them in the open.

dialogues.speaker: OREIUS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Oreius nods respectfully. Peter nods, kingly. The centaur wheels away. Then Edmund nudges his brother, whispering. Peter looks d to see...he’s wearing just one shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun waits below the horizon. Susan and Lucy sit with Aslan’s body. His ropes lie on th table around him, chewed free.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: He looks better in the light, doesn’t he? Susan watches a column of smoke purl from the camp below.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: We need to tell the others. Lucy strokes the Lion's flank, her voice choking.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But... Lucy bursts into tears. Gently, Susan pulls her away from the table. Lucy wraps her arms around herself. LUCY (cont‘d) I’m so cold. They walk toward the Eastern slope. Then A LOW RUMBLE slowly builds.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What ’s-

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Susan!

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: Susan and Lucy pitch to the ground, terrified.  Markus & Mcreely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. lll. THE WORLD TREMBLES for a few seconds, then subsides, leav the hill in silence. Susan grips the grass. Lucy gets up, slowly. She turns around and...GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK RUNNING END TO END.
dialogues.text: The girls stare up at the jagged rock.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But...why?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: They've taken Aslan!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But how? Is it more magic?

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Perhaps. They whip around to see...

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN, LARGER, SHINING IN THE SUNRISE, BRIGHTER THAN. GOL
dialogues.text: The girls tremble with astonishment, then... i GIRLS Aslan! They fling their arms around him, burying their faces in fur. Aslan purrs low. Lucy looks up.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But weren’t you...? Aslan licks her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: But we saw the knife! We saw you.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: While the Witch has a grasp of the Deep Magic, her knowledge goes back only to the dawn of time. Aslan gazes at the rising sun.  136 137 AWhaw Waen Lavo. Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 112. ASLAN (cont'd) ' But there is a magic deeper still, older than Narnia itself, a magic that goes beyond rules, to truth. To what is right and what is wrong. Aslan looks solemnly over to the shattered table. ASLAN (cont’d) And it appears that the Witch was not in the right... Aslan shakes his mighty mane and ROARS. The girls gape, thrilled. EXT. FORDS OF BERUNA — DAWN 136 Peter grips the unicorn’s reins, riding past...HUNDREDS O MARCHING NARNIAN TROOPS. In the middle of the long line, EDMUND RIDES ALONE. After a moment, Oreius falls alongside. Edmund nods. The centaur stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: __ ORELUS
dialogues.text: Your brother wants you to oversee the archérs and hold the high ground. Edmund looks up, surprised. Oreius marches, stone-faced. Oreius (cont! da) He has great faith in you. I questioned it. Finally, Oreius turns to the boy. Oreius (cont’d) He convinced me. Oreius stares at him, Edmund swallows. The centaur gives him a military nod and trots ahead. Edmund looks away, smiling. EXT. ASLAN'’S CAMP — DAY 137 Aslan sniffs at a smouldering fire.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: They have not been gone long.  138 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. Susan and Lucy stare about THE ABANDONED ‘CAMP. ASLAN (cont‘d) Peter has led his army to war.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Against her? Against those...things we saw last night?

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: It is what I asked of him. Lucy pulls out her dagger.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Then we have to help. Aslan gently lowers her arm.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: We will, dear one. But not that way.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Then how? Aslan bends low, stretching out his forepaws.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Climb on and-hold tight. We have far to go, and little time to get there. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 113. Tentatively, the girls climb on, gripping the Lion‘s mane ASLAN LEAPS, BOUNDING AWAY ACROSS THE COUNTRYSIDE. Susan SCREAMS. Lucy LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CENTAUR HOOF paws the ground. PETER’S ARMY, five thousand in all, stands nervous but re AN EAGLE SOARS THROUGH A CLOUDLESS SKY, over an open fiel crying a warning to the waiting troops. It wheels above a rocky outcropping. Below, EDMUND and MR BEAVER prepare CENTAURS and DWARF ARCHERS. The eagle swoops down to PETER and Oreius at the front, landing on Peter‘’s outstretched arm.  Markus & Mcreely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved.

dialogues.speaker: EAGLE
dialogues.text: They come, your Highness. In numbers and weapons far greater than our own. Peter stares at the advancing army. Oreius studies his

dialogues.speaker: OREIUS
dialogues.text: Numbers do not win a battle. Black battle flags snap above the massive horde.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (under his breath) No, but I bet they help. 114. face.

dialogues.speaker: A TRUMPET SOUNDS ACROSS THE BATTLE FIELD. THE WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: ARMY approaches, a seething mass of evil creatures.

dialogues.speaker: SQUADRONS OF CYCLOPS, BATTALIONS OF BLACK DWARFS. GENERAL
dialogues.text: OTMIN leads a PHALANX OF MINOTAURS. FINALLY, TWIN POLAR BEARS PULL A GLEAMING CHARIOT. At the reins stands Ginarrbrik, AND TOWERING ABOVE HIM, MAGNIFIC IN HER BATTLE MAIL AND FLOWING ROBES...THE WITCH. Peter looks to the Eagle. -... PETER : (cont'd) Did she offer terms? 139 EXT. BEAVERS’ DAM ~ DAY 139 Aslan vaults over the top of a hill, the two girls clingi tightly to him. They bound past the BEAVER’S DAM, now flowing with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rides in front of his troops.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Soldiers of Aslan! ‘Today, we face a grave battle...and likely a costly one. Oreius nods grimly. PETER (cont'd) it may not have to be that way...the Witch has offered a deal. Soldiers murmur. 140  Markus & McFreely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 115. PETER (cont‘d) She will withdraw and you may return to your homes...if Edmund and I surrender ourselves to her. Several bears growl. Peter raises his hand to quiet them. PETER (cont‘d) If you wish it, we will go. A faun scowls, shaking his head. PETER (cont’d) If you do not, we would consider it the greatest honor to stay and fight by your side.

dialogues.speaker: OREIUS
dialogues.text: I think you have your answer. Peter searches the hill behind him. He finds Edmund, standing with Beaver. Edmund nods, supportive. Peter lifts his sword, accepting their allegiance. ACROSS “THE FIELD, THE WITCH SMILES THINLY. Beside her, Ginarrbrik pulls on his. helmet. The Witch turns to GENERAL OTMIN.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE WITCH
dialogues.text: I‘m not interested in prisoners. Eradicate them.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY CHARGES.
dialogues.text: Peter waits, sword held high. THE DARK ARMY APPROACHES IN A CLOUD OF DUST. Finally, Peter swallows and...BRINGS DOWN HIS SWORD. EAGLES, FALCONS, GRIFFONS and HAWKS take flight, LARGE ST gripped in their talons. ROCKS FALL FROM THE SKY, cracking the skulls of the evil army, breaking their formation. BUT STILL...THEY ADVANCE. PETER POINTS HIS SWORD TOWARD THE ENEMY.

dialogues.speaker: CHARGE
dialogues.text: 141 142 143 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 116

dialogues.speaker: AGAINST THE NOW DISORGANIZED BLACK ARMY.
dialogues.text: CRASH. TALONS, CLAWS, SWORDS and LANCES COLLIDE. Creature on both sides fall. EXT. WITCH’S CASTLE - DAY 141 Aslan and the girls gallop toward THE WITCH’S CASTLE, now soft and melted. Ice falls from the decaying structure. Lucy swallows. Aslan digs his claws into the dirt, tensing his muscles, girls shut their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BATTLE RAGES. PETER‘’S ARMY HAS THE UPPER HAND. From his vantage point, EDMUND SEES THE WHITE WITCH SEND HER INFANTRY. He signals. “A FLAMING ARROW shoots high. A PHOENIX strafes the battlefield, disintegrating as it l down a WALL -OF ‘FIRE, cutting off the Witch‘’s troops. Peter’s troops cheer. But then the Witch drives her chariot right through, EXTINGUISHING THE FIRE. Her army pours in. PETER SIGNALS A RETREAT BACK TO THE ROCKS. Riding for safety, he passes... Oreius RIDING HARD TOWARD THE WHITE WITCH. Oreius leaps over her polar bears, swinging at her. She ducks, and with a THRUST OF HER WAND, TURNS HIM TO STONE. INT. WITCH’S CASTLE, COURTYARD 143 A STONE CENTAUR stands in the courtyard. ASLAN LANDS LIGHTLY BESIDE IT. The girls roll off. Susan flattens her hands on the reassuring ground.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don't think anything’s broken.  144 145 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 117. Then she looks up to see... , A TWELVE FOOT STONE GIANT TOWERING OVER HER. Ominous ston animals fill the courtyard. The girls look to Aslan, confused and horrified. ASLAN APPROACHES A STONE UNICORN. He leans forward and... BREATHES ON ITS FACE. A WARM GLOW SPREADS OVER THE UNICORN, moving across his frozen body LIKE A FLAME CATCHING. Lucy and Susan gape, astounded. All around them, STATUES COME BACK TO LIFE. THE STONE TIGER stretches himself awake, Edmund's CHARCOA GLASSES AND MUSTACHE still scrawled on his face. Two nearby DOGS giggle.

dialogues.speaker: STONE TIGER
dialogues.text: What? What? ASLAN ROARS in the middle of the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Leave no. corner unsearched. . Today all the Witch's prisoners go free! Lucy’s eyes go wide. She frantically searches the courtya Suddenly, she skids to a stop, gaping in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battlefield lies silent. STONE STATUES and WOUNDED SOLDIER litter the ground. Suddenly, A DISTANT CLASH echoes from the ROCKS. A GRYPHO dives into the skirmish. EXT. BATTLEFIELD, ROCKS — DAY 145 THE WHITE WITCH runs down a FAUN, turning him to stone. EDMUND’S ARCHERS take down one of her POLAR BEARS, throwi the WHITE WITCH AND Ginarrbrik from the chariot. PETER watches as Ginarrbrik UNLEASHES THE OTHER POLAR BEA IT CHARGES UP THE HILL AT THE UNSUSPECTING EDMUND. PETER'S unicorn breaks into a gallop. Fighting off WEREWOLVES, PETER TAKES DOWN THE POLAR BEAR.  146 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 118. OTMIN spies Peter and throws his axe, hitting the unicorn knocking Peter from his saddle. Peter scrambles for his sword but Otmin towers over him. At the last moment, with its dying breath, the UNICORN PIERCES OfMIN’S BREAST PLATE. Peter springs up, only to find himself SURROUNDED BY OGRE Across the field, Edmund spies...THE WITCH STALKING STRAI FOR PETER. Oblivious, PETER fights on. EDMUND RUNS, fighting valiantly, vaulting over statues. The Witch closes in on Peter, his back turned. SHE RAISES HER WAND. THE TIP SPARKLES.

dialogues.speaker: TWO.
dialogues.text: Half the wand falls harmlessly to the ground, JUST..A STI Peter spins. — The Witch stares from the broken wand in her hand...to Edmund. HER GREEN EYES GO WIDE. EDMUND TRIES TO ROLL CLEAR. But with a terrifying SCREAM, she STABS HIM WITH THE JAGG END OF HER WAND.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No! Edmund lies still, the wand sticking from his ribs.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: INT. WITCH’S CASTLE, COURTYARD 146 ASLAN JOINS LUCY AS SHE STARES INTO AN ALCOVE... Across the way, Susan watches A GIANT shake itself awake. looks down at a DWARF at his feet.  Mackus « mreely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 119.

dialogues.speaker: DWARF
dialogues.text: Rumblebuffin? Is that you? The Giant smiles and picks him up.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Susan? Susan turns to see LUCY holding hands with MR. TUMNUS. LUCY (cont'd) I’d like you to meet Mr. Tumnus. Susan smiles, teary eyed. Mr. Tumnus holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUMNUS
dialogues.text: It's a pleasure, Susan Pevensie. Impulsively, Susan wraps her arms around him. ASLAN ADDRESSES THEM ALL.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Now come with me, and we shall set all of Narnia free. 147 EXT. WITCH’S« CASTLE - DAY : 147 THE GIANT’S ENORMOUS FIST BASHES THROUGH AN ICE WALL. ASLAN LEAPS THROUGH THE HOLE, THE GIRLS ASTRIDE.HIS BACK. HUNDREDS OF CREATURES pour after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and the Witch battle through the huge, high rocks.

dialogues.speaker: A BACKLIT SILHOUETTE APPEARS...ASLAN.
dialogues.text: Hundreds of other shadows join him along the cliff top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASLAN'S SHADOW falls over the skirmish. THE WHITE WITCH'S TROOPS TURN AND FLEE.  151 152 Markus & mcreely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 120. ASLAN‘S EYES SCAN THE BATTLEFIELD. HE SPIES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WITCH, as she grabs Peter‘’s elbow and twists. His sword clatters across the rocks. THE WITCH KICKS PETER IN THE HEAD. He sprawls to the grou Helpless, Peter looks up. The Witch’s eyes gleam THEN SUDDENLY...A LOW GROWL. THE WITCH'S EYES POP WIDE TO SEE... ASLAN, cutting through the throng of the battle, EYES FIX RIGHT ON HER.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND.
dialogues.text: Peter stares, awed and terrified.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN.
dialogues.text: Gradually, the noiige of the battle fades. AND THOUGH REINFORCEMENTS BATTLE ALI AROUND THEM... PETER AND ASLAN STAND ALONE. ASLAN GAZES AT HIM WITH SORROWFUL LOOK. EXT. BATTLEFIELD, ROCKS — LATER 152 Susan and Lucy stare down at the smouldering battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Peter! They run down. Lucy hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Where's Edmund? TEARS WELL IN HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Susan wades through the wreckage.  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 12i.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Her cries echo across the battlefield to where... EDMUND LIES, his fingers grasping at the wand stuck in hi side. PAN over the weapon-strewn ground to... Ginarrbrik, lying in the mud, blood seeping from his forehead. HE STARES AT EDMUND, EYES RED WITH HATE. The dwarf’s gnarled hand reaches out and grips AN AXE. He drags himself to his feet. HIS SHADOW falls over the helpless Edmund. The boy's eyes flutter, then freeze with fear. Above him, Ginarrbrik bares his black teeth and RAISES TH AXE. ACROSS THE FIELD, the other Pevensies search frantically. SUDDENLY, SUSAN SEES SOMETHING OVER PETER’S SHOULDER. : SUSAN (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: Peter drops, as: Susan WHIPS AN ARROW FROM HER QUIVER. SHE LETS FLY. Ginarrbrik starts to swing his axe, then STOPS. He looks down: THE POINT OF AN ARROW PROTRUDES FROM HIS SHOULDER. HE TOPPLES OVER, INCAPACITATED. Peter, Susan and Lucy race over. Susan cradles Edmund's head. Peter stares at his wounds. They both turn to Lucy. She fumbles and produces the TINY CRYSTAL VIAL. She drops her knees and unstops the bottle. ONE GLISTENING DROP splashes onto Edmund's lips. Edmund's ragged breath becomes regular. After a moment, h eyes open. He smiles, weak but alive. Lucy hugs him for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lucy.  153 154 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 122. Aslan stands behind them, his face stern. ASLAN (cont'd) There are many others wounded. Lucy looks down at Edmund, bothered.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I know. Just a minute. Aslan gives a low growl.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Daughter of Eve, there are others at the point of death. Must more people die for Edmund? Lucy swallows. She and Susan share a long look.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Lucy hurries to help a fallen centaur. Aslan moves on, breathing life back into the frozen statu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three children gather around as... Edmund kneels before Aslan. The Lion gently lays his paw the boy’s head.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: Now rise, Sir Edmund, Knight of Narnia, hero of the Battle of Beruna. Edmund struggles to his feet, honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy walk on either side of Asla Behind them, the victorious army marches, jubilant. The Beavers gambol in the surf. Mr. Tumnus picks his way along the sand, trying to stay dry. Peter stops. In the distance...CAIR PARAVEL shimmers, ivo spires clear against the blue sky.  155 156 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 123, For a moment, all four Pevensies just stare. Suddenly, A GIANT WAVE SOAKS THEM. ASLAN SPLASHES in the water, growling playfully. They run after him, laughing, being children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERMEN AND MERMAIDS splash in the surf beneath the balcon the Great Hall. They look up as...TRUMPETS BLARE. INT. CAITR PARAVEL, GREAT HALL — DAY 156 A RED DWARF blows a strangely curved trumpet. SUNLIGHT POURS THROUGH STAINED GLASS WINDOWS DOWN ONTO... FOUR THRONES. THE CHILDREN STARE, ASTONISHED. On one, the carving of A SWORD. .On another, A HORN. A th features A TINY BOTTLE. On the last has been carved...A WAND, BROKEN. IN TWO. Lucy looks to Aslan. He nods. She sits in her-throne, tentative. Then she looks down to find A BEAUTIFULLY CARVED FOOT-REST, JUST HER SIZE. THE PEVENSIES SIT GRANDLY UPON THEIR THRONES. Narnians crowd the hall, gazing happily. They part as... Aslan enters. He stops in front of the children. After a long, proud moment, he nods. MR. TUMNUS pins a SILVER LAUREL to Lucy's hair.

dialogues.speaker: ASLAN
dialogues.text: To the Eastern Sea I give you Queen Lucy, the valiant. Oreius perches a SILVER CROWN on Edmund‘s head. ASLAN (cont‘d) To the Western Wood, King Edmund, the just.  157 158 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 124, MRS. BEAVER places a RING OF GOLDEN FLOWERS on Susan. ASLAN (cont‘d) To the Radiant Southern Sun, Queen Susan, the gentle. Finally, MR. BEAVER rests a HEAVY GOLD CROWN on Peter. ASLAN (cont’d) And to the clear Northern sky I give you King Peter, the magnificent. The Pevensies sit crowned, the PROPHECY FULFILLED. ASLAN (cont'd) May you rule long, Kings and Queens of Narnia, and may your wisdom grace us until the stars rain down from the heavens. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOYOUS “MUSIC®PLAYS. Peter dances nervously with the CHER TREE ‘DRYAD from the forest. . She. smiles: at him. He bl Susan does a.turn with THE FOX, his red fur fluffed up. H hops as the BEAVERS waltz by, their tails sweeping the fl Creatures gather around the feasting table. Edmund loads his plate. Suddenly, he freezes. Before him sits a big platter of...TURKISH DELIGHT. He reaches out. Just then, LUCY WHISKS IT AWAY. They share a grin. Through the dancers, LUCY NOTICES A GOLDEN FIGURE SLIPPIN OUT INTO THE SUNSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy rushes out to find Mx. Tumnus standing at the railin Down below, Aslan walks along the shore...away from Cair Paravel.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Is he coming back?  Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 125. She watches Aslan grow smaller and smaller.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUMNUS
dialogues.text: In time. One day you’ll see him and another you won’t. It’s all right. He'll often drop in. But you mustn’t press him. They both stare out at the Lion retreating in the distanc MR. TUMNUS (cont'd) After all, he’s not a tame lion.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: But he is good. Lucy’s eyes well up with tears. Tumnus offers her HIS HANDKERCHIEF.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUMNUS
dialogues.text: Here, you need it more than I do. Finally, Aslan disappears into the darkness, leaving only...HIS DEEP FOOTPRINTS IN THE WET SAND. THE FOOTPRINTS FADE AS THE LIGHT GRADUALLY TURNS TO DAY.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE TO FIND
dialogues.text: LUCY, NOW A LOVELY YOUNG WOMAN, staring over the same str of golden sand. Her silver laurel glints on her head. A BELL RINGS FROM THE HIGHEST TOWER. Lucy looks over at a table across the balcony. MR. TUMNUS, older, stouter, has tea with a FULLY GROWN... SUSAN, long hair braided beneath her crown of golden flow She smiles up from her embroidery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong hand moves a GOLDEN KNIGHT across a chessboard. EDMUND, A HANDSOME, SERIOUS MAN in his silver crown, look across the board at Oreius. Gray flecks the centaur'’s co THE BELL RINGS. Edmund and Oreius look up.  161 162 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 126

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER GALLOPS THROUGH THE GATES, A MASTER HORSEMAN. He le down and bows low in one swiftly gallant motion. Everyone waits in the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: OREIUS
dialogues.text: Welcome home, King Peter.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: My lord is a bit of a show-off this morning.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It‘s only because of the news I bring. Smiling, he fixes his hat back upon his head. PETER (cont'd) The White Stag has been seen in Narnia. The courtyard goes silent. Lucy ‘grins. EXT. THE STONE TABLE, AUTUMN — DAY 161 Susan gallops across a grassy field. Peter, Edmund and Lu ride ahead, dressed for the hunt. Above them loom the ruins of the Stone Table, overgrown w orange flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group slows to a walk, picking through a thicket. Suddenly, THE WHITE STAG tears away through the woods. Lucy kicks into a gallop. The others follow. The White Stag stays just out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The riders burst out to find...THE WHITE STAG GONE. Inste there, in the middle of the clearing stands...  Markus « McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 127. A METAL POST. They stop, curious. Peter circles his horse around the po

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Tis’ a tree...of iron.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: But if you look upon it there is a lantern set atop. What purpose is this?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: By likelihood it was placed here when the trees were fewer. Peter dismounts, reaching out to touch the pole.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: By the Lion’s mane, it works upon me strangely.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It runs. in my mind also. As if in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: or a dream of a dream. The others climb off their horses, letting them graze. Edmund peers inte the dark wood.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: Did anyone see in which direction our noble prey did go? A cold wind blows.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Perhaps it did go home. Perhaps the Great. Wisdom comes in...not catching it. But going where we have soft beds and hot food, won't we then learn all the more about...the comforts of home? Edmund and Lucy share an eye-roll. Just then, THE WHITE STAG bursts from the brush. The four scramble after it on foot, into the woods. SUSAN'S HORN hangs from her saddle, left behind.  164 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 128. The Kings and Queens run, breathless. The wood grows dark and quieter until... SUSAN (cont‘d) Does anyone see it?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Is that not something over there? The Pevensies step forward, slowly, arms out. Darkness envelops them.

dialogues.speaker: EDMUND
dialogues.text: I feel a strangeness.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: These are not branches... A SHAFT OF LIGHT APPEARS AHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: They’re...coats? INT. WARDROBE ROOM — DAY 164

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIRKE
dialogues.text: Oh...I‘m sorry, I didn’t know you were in here... They stare around, dumbfounded. The Professor looks curio at Peter, Susan, Lucy and Edmund, sitting on the floor. PROFESSOR KIRKE (cont'd) What were you all doing in the wardrobe? The Pevensies look at each other. Slowly, their astonishm turns to COMPULSIVE LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thou woulds‘t not believe us if we told of it, sire. This makes the others laugh more. The Professor merely smiles knowingly.  165 166 Markus & McFeely AA Rev. 12-10-03 Estate Approved. 129.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIRKE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? The laughter is replaced with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight fills the silent hall. A door creaks. Lucy steps out, tiptoeing in her nightgown. She steals do the hall, around the corner, and up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wardrobe stands silent against the wall. Lucy bites her lip, and opens the door to find...COATS. S pushes them aside. Nothing but coats.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIRKE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I’m afraid you won‘’t get back in that way. Lucy spins. THE PROFESSOR sits quietly in his bathrobe an pajamas. He smiles sheepishly. PROFESSOR KIRKE (cont‘d) I already tried.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Will we ever go back?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KIRKE
dialogues.text: I guess you'll just have to keep your eyes open. Lucy smiles back. Then she closes the Wardrobe and holds her hand. He takes it. They pad softly back to bed. Leaving the room dark and quiet. All is still. Then, with creak, the Wardrobe door...opens. And A SHAFT OF GOLDEN LIGHT spills into the room. FADE OUT.
